meanings.definition: To put in place or position.
meanings.sent1: She emplaced the vase on the table.
meanings.sent2: The workers emplaced the new sign outside the building.
meanings.sent3: The cat emplaced itself on the warm spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The puzzle pieces emplaced perfectly together to reveal the picture.
meanings.sent5: He emplaced the key in the lock and turned it with a click.

meanings.definition: To establish or set in a particular location.
meanings.sent1: The team emplaced their base camp at the foot of the mountain.
meanings.sent2: The artist emplaced her sculptures throughout the garden.
meanings.sent3: The book emplaced the story in a magical land far away.
meanings.sent4: Her words emplaced a sense of calm in the chaotic situation.
meanings.sent5: The memories were emplaced in his mind like precious jewels.
